summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to FBI personnel, dated June 12, 2020, requesting a follow-up call to discuss financial investigation topics related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The topics include identifying her active financial accounts, her connection to UMB Bank, the status of a subpoena issued on September 25, 2019, and recent Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) or Currency Transaction Report (CTR) filings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email discusses an ongoing financial investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, seeking information about her active accounts, bank connections, and recent financial filings.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Financial Institution
events.description: A subpoena was issued to a financial institution (context suggests UMB Bank) regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's accounts.

events.title: Scheduled Follow-up Call
events.description: A call was scheduled for Monday, June 15, 2020, at 10 a.m. between the AUSA and FBI personnel to discuss the financial investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell's financial accounts as of June 2020, including credit cards and her connection to UMB Bank.
A subpoena was issued to a financial institution on September 25, 2019, regarding Maxwell's accounts, and returns had not been received by SDNY as of the email date.
The investigation sought to determine if any Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs) or Currency Transaction Reports (CTRs) had been filed for Maxwell's accounts in the past year.
The correspondence indicates coordinated financial investigation efforts between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the FBI.
